result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered CASE DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing on cases 2021CF973 and 2021CF3900.
Motion for Joinder, filed by the State
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Dismissal.  (Charles H. Trempala - #2021012060, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Turnover to level 5 supervision with all previoulsy ordered conditions of bail

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND .Case remains calendared for jury trial 08-29-2022 at 9:00 anm, Branch 2 via Zoom.

Defendant Charles H Trempala in court via zoom.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court.  Defendant Charles H Trempala in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for (SPEEDY) Jury Trial.  Discussion placed on the record.  Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel requests an adjournment  due to being in trial in branch 12.
State is ready to proceed. Case passed until 1:30pm to address remainder of the Court's calendar.  The case was recalled at 1:44.  Defense counsel assert Speedy demand for reasons stated on the record.   Defense counsel requesting a bail review.
The court order the matter adjourned branch 2.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in court (appears in person) with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones (appears via Zoom video).  Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears via Zoom video).
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.
State and defense counsel advise Court they remain in trial posture.
Defense counsel advises Court he has a speedy trial scheduled in Branch 12 on June 6.
Discussion with the parties as to joinder motion; cases are not currently joined for purposes of trial; State advises Court he will be filing a joinder motion prior to the date of trial.
Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 2.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled off the record. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Parties are advised that due to the defendants lower pending matter 21CF3900 this matter is reassigned to Br. 2 Judge Childs. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Detective S. Kuhnmuench. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  

This hearing will be streamed live on 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  

Scheduling conference scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed letter from Defendant.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring with a   24 hour curfew with the exception of verified dental, medical and legal appointments..  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $35,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Calvin G & Jandel T

Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles Isaiah Harris Trempala appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.   Motion to dismiss the case by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
